intro: Fitzroya cupressoides, commonly known as the Ñire Ñire, is a slow-growing conifer native to southern South America. It is characterized by its tall, straight trunk and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant has a long lifespan, with some individuals living over 2,000 years, making it one of the oldest tree species in the world. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against fires and pests. The cones are small and woody, containing seeds that are dispersed by wind and animals.
